english.text: Appearances can be deceiving.
Acts of kindness may soon be forgotten, but the memory of an offense remains.
Seeing is believing.
english.description: People don’t often believe something, unless they see it.

english.text: It’s the tip of the iceberg.
english.description: The bigger issue is that this particular problem isn’t the worst one you will encounter. It is highly likely that far worse issues lie ahead.

english.text: If you scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours.
english.description: If you help me, I will return the favor and help you.

english.text: The forbidden fruit is always the sweetest.
english.description: Doing something that you know you shouldn’t always feel good. Just thinking about the act can make you feel good.

english.text: You can’t make an omelet without breaking a few eggs.
english.description: To achieve anything in life you will encounter a few problems, sometimes you will have to make a few sacrifices in the short term to achieve a greater long term goal.

english.text: There is no use in crying over spilt milk.
english.description: Once a mistake has been made, there is no point in dwelling on it. Moving on is the easiest option. When something is done, it’s done. You can’t change the past.

english.text: Anyone inexperienced puts faith in every word, but the shrewd one considers his steps.
english.description: Someone who has little experience in life may believe almost anything said to them, but a person who has experience in life doesn’t believe everything he hears. He will think before taking any action based on what was said.

english.text: Enjoy it while it lasts.
english.description: How do you feel on the final day of your vacation? Sad and upset it has already passed? Enjoy it while it lasts, means to make sure we don’t waste our time when we are doing something enjoyable.

english.text: Failing to plan is planning to fail.
english.description: It is a tongue twister to say out loud, but it is very clever advice. Success is often dependent on good planning. If we don’t make plans in advance, we are more likely to be unsuccessful.

english.text: Love of money is the root of all evil.
english.description: Perhaps not a proverb as much as it is a general truth. Sadly, the love of money causes many people to lie, steal and cheat from others. Greed, the love of money is sadly the primary cause of many terrible things that happen in the world.

english.text: Patience is a virtue.
english.description: Any virtue, is an excellent, admirable quality that we should all aspire to obtain. Patience is something many of us lack and therefore a quality which most of us find desirable and like to see in others.

english.text: You can take a horse to water, but you can’t make it drink.
english.description: Because a horse has a mind of its own, only the horse can decide whether it wants to drink the water. The same applies to people. We can advise another person, but we can’t make them take the advice and use it, that part is up to them.

english.text: You cannot serve two masters.
english.description: Anyone who tries to do two things at the same time will either do well at one thing and not the other or fail at both. It is impossible to do both things well at the same time.

english.text: Never judge a book by its cover.
english.description: You should never make a judgment about something or someone simply based on first impressions. In many circumstances, you will find out that you are wrong.

english.text: A barking dog rarely bites.
english.description: If someone looks physically aggressive either by their outward appearance or the things that they say, but when it comes to confrontation, they back away. A proverb that is linked to this one but means the same is 'his bark is worse than his bite'.

english.text: If it isn’t broke, don’t fix it.
english.description: When someone might take situation upon themselves to try to alter something that is already working perfectly fine.

english.text: Give him an inch and he will take a mile.
english.description: If a man were to loan his friend some money and allowed him a longer time than usual to pay it back, so the friend kept returning asking for more money and more time.

english.text: Beauty is skin deep.
english.description: Similar to the proverb above, this one talks about a persons outward appearance not aligning with their true personality. It means a person who may appear physically beautiful on the outside but has less than desirable inner personality traits. For example, you could use this proverb when talking about a supermodel who despite being outwardly gorgeous, is rude and obnoxious to those she works with.

english.text: The grass isn’t always greener on the other side.
english.description: Something that looks great from afar, may not be what you think once you get closer. Be happy with what you already have.

english.text: It is better to have loved and lost, than to never have loved at all.
english.description: If you had never fallen in love you would never have had that experience or been able to learn from it, so whilst it is painful, it is also a lesson and something that you know more about now.

english.text: A leopard never changes its spots.
english.description: The meaning here is referring to a personality trait of someone, usually not a very good one and that once someone has adopted that trait, they will never be able to change it. This proverb is often used when talking about someone who has been unfaithful in their relationship.

english.text: It is no use locking the stable door after the horse has bolted.
english.description: If your aim was to keep your horse safely locked in its stable, it is too late to achieve this if you only lock the door after the horse has escaped.

english.text: Shrewd is the one that has seen the calamity and proceeds to conceal himself.
english.description: A shrewd or intelligent person is someone who is smart and thinks ahead. They will take action to protect themselves from any danger that they think could happen.

english.text: Early in the year, early in the month, early in the week, early in the day.
english.description: To stress how important our time is, we are encouraged to do things as soon as possible and not delay.

english.text: Don’t place all your eggs in one basket.
english.description: This proverb warns us about putting all of our trust into one thing that could fail.

english.text: Do to others as you would have them do to you.
english.description: Treat others the way you would like them to treat you.

english.text: An answer when mild turns away rage.
english.description: Everyone has arguments and fights. During a heated fight, we might feel angry which may cause us to say unkind things about the other person. If we say something in anger, this will only make the argument worse.

english.text: Leave no stone unturned.
english.description: To achieve your goal, you should try every possibility.

english.text: What’s done is done.
english.description: You cannot change what has already happened.

english.text: It never rains, but it pours.
english.description: Bad luck never comes alone. Bad things usually happen all together at once.

english.text: First things first.
english.description: Be patient. Do the things in their correct order.

english.text: Measure twice, cut one.
english.description: It’s hard to change a decision, once you’ve made it.

english.text: Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
To save oneself, one must take risks and struggle.
Don’t think problem, think opportunity.
The problem with troubleshooting is that trouble shoots back.
Confidence is the feeling you have before you understand the situation.
Put no faith in a drunkard’s prophecy, another man’s dog, or the weather at any season.
Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.
Better a meal of vegetables where there is love than a fattened calf with hatred.
A man gift will make a way for him.
Sorrow is better than laughter, for by the sadness of the face the heart is made better.
Seek and ye shall find.
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in the power of your hand to do so.
As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
Be not curious in unnecessary matters: for more things are shrewd unto thee than men understand.
A good name is better than precious ointment.
A good name is more desirable than great riches.
Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
Stupid people always think they are right. Wise people listen to advice.
The eye is the mirror of the soul.
Be not deceived with the first appearance of things, for show is not substance.
There is not so much comfort in having children as there is sorrow in parting with them.
He who sings, frightens away all his ills.
Red sky at night, sailor’s delight. Red sky at morning, sailors take warning.
In a bet there is a fool and a thief.
Rule: Never perform card tricks for the people you play poker with.
Lucky at cards, unlucky in love.
With someone holding nothing but trumps it is impossible to play cards.
The devil is not so black as he is painted.
Competition is the whetstone of talent.
You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
The longest day soon comes to an end.
We all end up in a single bed sooner or later.
Soon learned, soon forgotten.
Long absent, soon forgotten.
Soon enough is well enough.
As soon as man is born he begins to die.
March comes in like a lion and goes out like a lamb.
The cuckoo comes in April, and stays the month of May; sings a song at midsummer, and then goes away.
We come and cry and that is life, we cry and go and that is death.
If the mountain will not come to Mahomet, Mahomet must go to the mountain.
Easy come, easy go.
english.description: It’s as easy to make money as to lose it

english.text: Rain, rain, go away, come again another day.
Sickness comes on horseback, but goes away on foot.
A beetle is a beauty in the eyes of his mother.
Never burn your fingers to snuff another man’s candle.
After shaking hands with a Greek, count your fingers.
Wash your hands often, your feet seldom, and your head never.
A bit of fragrance always clings to the hand that gives you roses.
The hand that rocks the cradle rules the world.
A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
english.description: It's better to hold onto something you have rather than take the risk of getting something better which may come to nothing.

english.text: The pleasure of what we enjoy is lost by coveting more.
You cannot be lost on a road that is straight.
A hundred years cannot repair a moment’s loss of honor.
No one with a good catch of fish goes home by the back alley.
An Englishman’s home is his castle.
A woman’s place is in the home.
If an ass goes traveling it will not come home a horse.
A king’s castle is his home.
East, west, home’s best.
It is the fate of the great ones of this earth, to be appreciated only after they are gone.
People who have bread to eat do not appreciate the severity of a famine.
Laugh and grow fat.
Laugh before breakfast, you’ll cry before supper.
If you are too busy to laugh, you are too busy.
Force without forecast is to little avail.
Force is that which rules the actions without regulating the will.
When a man repeats a promise again and again, he means to fail you.
He loses his thanks who promises and delays.
A promise is a comfort for a fool.
There are no greater promisers than those who have nothing to give.
A promise is a debt.
The weakness of an enemy forms part of our own strength.
Birds of a feather flock together.
english.description: People who share a common ground will usually be more drawn to one another.

english.text: The family that prays together stays together.
It takes two to tango.
If a job’s worth doing, it’s worth doing well.
Doing is better than saying.
If the young knew and the old could, there is nothing that couldn’t be done.
If you want a thing well done, do it yourself.
He that is doing nothing is seldom in need of helpers.
Could everything be done twice it would be done better.
By doing nothing we learn to do ill.
Easier said than done.
Pay beforehand if you would have your work poorly done.
One lives in the world’s memory only by what they have done in the world’s behalf.
What’s done cannot be undone.
Keep going, for success lies just around the corner for those who refuse to quit.
Quit not certainty for hope.
The dog that quits barking can get some sleep.
It’s when things get rough and you don’t quit, that success comes.
When the will is ready the feet are light.
If you wish for peace be ready for war.
When one is prepared, difficulties do not come.
You must be fully prepared to lose a great deal in order to make a great deal.
Opportunity seldom knocks twice.
english.description: You probably won’t get another chance, so it’s better to take one right now.

english.text: Opportunities neglected can never be recovered.
Four things come not back: the spoken word, the spent arrow, the past life, and the neglected opportunity.
Opportunities may come but they never linger.
He has hard work who has nothing to do.
The hardest work of all is to do nothing.
Some have been thought brave because they didn’t have the courage to run away.
Leave well alone.
The man who never makes a mistake always takes orders from one who does.
The first mistake are theirs who commit them, the second are theirs that permit them.
Revenge is a dish that tastes better cold.
Revenge is sweet.
If you want to be revenged, hold your tongue.
He, who fears to suffer, suffers from fear.
Don’t meet troubles half-way.
A soft answer turneth away wrath.
Bad news travels fast.
Any publicity is good publicity.
Curiosity killed the cat.
english.description: A polite way of telling someone to “Mind your own business”. Pay attention to your own life, ignore things that don’t concern you.

english.text: Give a dog a bad name and hang him.
Good men must die, but death cannot kill their names.
A person with a bad name is already half-hanged.
From our ancestors come our names from our virtues our honor.
No names, no pack-drill.
Young people talk of what they are doing; old people of what they have done; and fools of what they have a mind to do.
Many talk like philosophers yet live like fools.
People who have little to do are excessive talkers.
The less people think the more they talk.
Talk of the devil, and he is bound to appear.
In teaching others we teach ourselves.
To teach well, we need not say all that we know, Successful teachers are effective in spite of the psychological theories they suffer under.
A wise teacher makes learning a joy.
He who does not research has nothing to teach.
Experience is the best teacher.
Whatever you teach, be brief; what is quickly said the mind readily receives and faithfully retains, while everything superfluous runs over as from a full container. Who knows much says least.
Experience is the mother of wisdom.
They two agreed like two cats in a gutter.
The devil dances in an empty pocket
There’s one law for the rich, and another for the poor.
Fools and obstinate men make lawyers rich.
It is better to be born lucky than rich.
Fools live poor to die rich.
As the person who has health is young, so the person who owes nothing is rich.
Riches have wings.
People lend only to the rich.
Physicians’ faults are covered with earth, and rich men’s with money.
Whoever does not respect confidence will never find happiness in their path.
When money is taken freedom is forsaken.
Who ever does not respect confidence will never find happiness in their path.
They that envy others are their inferiors.
Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of loyalty.
Third time lucky.
See a pin and pick it up, all the day you’ll have good luck; see a pin and let it lie, you’ll want a pin before you die.
Luck is the idol of the idle.
An honest man is the noblest work of God.
Short lived pleasure is the parent of pain.
No pleasure without pain.
An hour of pain is as long as a day of pleasure.
He that is uneasy at every little pain is never without some ache.
That which is escaped now is pain to come.
He who begins and does not finish loves their pains.
Our passions are the winds that propel our vessel. Our reason is the pilot that steers her. Without winds the vessel would not move and without a pilot she would be lost.
Try and trust will move mountains.
If you trust before you try, you may repent before you die.
A jack of both sides, is before long, trusted by nobody, and abused by both parties.
When a heart is on fire, sparks always fly out of the mouth.
A constant guest is never welcome.
In calm water every ship has a good captain.
We cannot direct the wind, but we can adjust the sails.
Sailors have a port in every storm.
Hoist your sail when the wind is fair.
Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
A misty morning does not signify a cloudy day.
An hour in the morning is worth two in the evening.
Red sky at morning, sailors take warning.
Better to sit all night than to go to bed with a dragon.
Living in the past has one thing going for it; it’s cheaper!
Patience, money and time bring all things to past.
Confess you were wrong yesterday; it will show you are wise today.
One swallow does not make a summer.
Needs must when the devil drives.
Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
The first step toward greatness is to be honest.
You can’t teach old dog new tricks.
A trouble shared is a trouble halved.
Think late, suffer soon.
Music helps not the toothache.
Slow but sure wins the race.
It’s when things get rough and you don’t quit that success comes.
Many people quit looking for work when they find a job.
Saying is one thing, and doing another.
No pillows so soft as God’s promise.
Persuasion is better than force.
Unless a serpent devour a serpent it will not become a dragon. Unless one power absorb another, it will not become great.
Age is the price of wisdom.
Just because you’re not sick doesn’t mean you’re healthy.
Health is better than wealth.
A good wife and health are a man’s best wealth.
Keep your eye on the ball and your head in the game.
The eyes are the window of the soul.
Among the blind the one eyed is king.
Keep your mouth shut and your eyes open.
It will all come right in the wash.
Cast no dirt into the well that gives you water.
No one knows what the dinner was after the plates have been washed.
Salt water and absence wash away love.
There’s only one pretty child in the world, and every mother has it.
Time cures the sick man, not the ointment.
Tobacco hic, Will make a man well if he be sick.
Sickness soaks the purse.
No man is a good physician who has never been sick.
The superior doctor prevents sickness; the mediocre doctor attends to impending sickness; the inferior doctor treats actual sickness.
Sickness is felt, but health not at all.
An army of deer would be more formidable commanded by a lion, than a an army of lions commanded by a stag.
A dog that barks much is never a good hunter.
The most noble dog can only bark.
Every dog is allowed one bite.
Conscience is the dog that can’t bite, but never stops barking.
A good dog deserves a good bone.
Two dogs strive for a bone and the third one runs off with it.
Every dog has his day.
english.description: When someone uses the proverb, they are talking about the fact that every person, despite their situation or how fortunate they may or may not be, will have a moment of success at some point. For example, someone who is unlucky in love and suddenly meets his soulmate, you might use this proverb in that situation.

english.text: Why keep a dog and bark yourself?
Take a hair of the dog that bit you.
The silent dog is the first to bite.
Dog does not eat dog.
Let sleeping dogs lie.
Better a living dog than a dead lion.
Barking dogs seldom bite.
Love me, love my dog.
The loudest bark rids not a dog of his fleas.
Big fish eat little fish.
No matter how hard you throw a dead fish in the water, it still won’t swim.
Old soldiers never die, they simply fade away.
Nothing is nobler than politeness, and nothing more ridiculous than ceremony.
Never offer to teach a fish to swim.
Never judge from appearances.
A period of travel and relaxation when you take twice the clothes and half the money you need.
Humor is a whisper from the soul, imploring mind and body to relax, let go and be at peace again.
Live For Today…Plan For Tomorrow…Party Tonight..!
Achievement is largely the product of steadily raising one’s levels of aspirations and expectations.
Love puts the fun in together, the sad in apart, and the joy in a heart.
It is a mistake to suppose that people succeed through success; they often succeed through failures.
The happiness in this life does not consist of being devoid of passion, but mastering them.
A few moments of misplaced values can mean a lifetime of regret.
Passion is the trigger of success.
You can teach a student a lesson for a day; but if you can teach him to learn by creating curiosity, he will continue the learning process as long as he lives.
Agreement makes law.
Short acquaintance brings repentance.
Confession is the first step to repentance.
All temptations are found in either hope or fear.
Never step over one duty to perform another.
Sincerity is not to say everything you think but to mean everything you say.
Innocent actions carry their warrant with them.
Oh what a tangled web we weave, when first we practice to deceive.
From listening comes wisdom and from speaking, repentance.
A wicked book cannot repent.
Marry in Lent, and you’ll live to repent.
Amendment is repentance.
If you can’t be good, be careful.
When a fox preaches, take care of your geese.
Caution is not cowardly. Carelessness is not courage.
The law helps those who watch, not those who sleep.
A mousetrap always provides free cheese.
Forgive and forget.
english.description: Forgive and forget the bad things that have been done to you. Don’t hold the grudge.

english.text: The noblest vengeance is to forgive.
Those that do you a very ill deed will never forgive you.
Nothing is more noble than politeness, and nothing more ridiculous than ceremony.
What the eye does not admire the heart does not desire.
Good habits result from resisting temptation.
The road to success is lined with many tempting parking spaces.
Every one is innocent until he is proved guilty.
To deceive oneself is very easy.
Ease and honor are seldom bedfellows.
There is honor among thieves.
Beware of men who flourish hereditary honors.
Money is truthful. If a man speaks of his honor, make him pay cash.
I have been a stranger in a strange land.
Let praise you and not your own mouth, a stranger and not your own lips.
Take care that you do not despise one of these little ones; for I tell you, in heaven their angels continually see the face of my Father.
Blessed is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown of life, which the Lord hath promised to them that love him.
He who is not tempted, what does he know? And he who is not tried, what are the things he knows?
God is faithful; he will not let you be tempted beyond what you can bear. But when you are tempted, he will also provide a way out so that you can stand up under it.
Before honor is humility.
If anyone has material possessions and sees his brother in need but has no pity on him, how can the love of God be in him?
He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver, nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
A hungry man is an angry man.
A black plum is as sweet as a white.
He that eats till he is sick must fast till he is well.
Don’t dig your grave with your knife and fork.
A hungry stomach has no ears.
The proof of the pudding is in the eating.
Revenge is a dish that should be eaten cold.
One rotten apple spoils the whole barrel.
An apple never falls far from the tree.
When flatterers meet, the devil goes to dinner.
When the wine is in, the wit is out.
Of wine the middle, of oil the top, and of honey the bottom is best.
Old praise dies unless you feed it.
A man without a mustache is like a cup of tea without sugar.
Make yourself all honey and the flies will devour you.
You can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make him drink.
Good words cool more than cold water.
We never know the worth of water until the well is dry.
Still waters run deep.
english.description: It a little like “don’t judge a book by its cover”. It simply means that a person may be quiet but still are very interesting once you get to know them.

english.text: Foul water will quench fire.
Give neither advice nor salt, until you are asked for it.
If wishes were horses then beggars would ride.
Gray hairs are death‘s blossoms.
Death keeps no calendar.
Death is a shadow that always follows the body.
Death always comes too early or too late.
Use soft words and hard arguments.
He that seeks trouble never misses.
Don’t dig your grave with your own knife and fork.
Better to go to bed hungry than to wake up in debt.
A good drink makes the old young.
The Irish ignore anything they can’t drink or punch.
Too many cooks spoil the broth.
english.description: If there are many people doing the same job, the result will come out to be bad.

english.text: Forbidden fruit is sweet.
Eat the wind and swallow bitterness.
Eat to live and not live to eat.
The most dangerous food to eat is a wedding cake.
Eat and drink measurably, and defy the medicines.
The apple does not fall far from the tree.
An apple a day keeps the doctor away.
english.description: You will not get sick if you eat fruit/ healthy food every day.

english.text: Never ask a favor of someone till they have had their dinner.
Drink wine, and have the gout; drink no wine, and have the gout too.
First the man takes a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes the man.
Children and drunks always speak the truth.
He who drinks a little too much drinks much too much.
Garlic is as good as ten mothers.
A nickel will get you on the subway, but garlic will get you a seat.
An apple-pie without some cheese is like a kiss without a squeeze.
Do not drink poison to quench a thirst.
One swallow will not make spring, nor one bee honey.
No bees, no honey; no work, no money.
A drop of honey catches more flies than a hogshead of vinegar.
Rebuke should have a grain more of salt than of sugar.
Much meat, much disease.
One man’s meat is another man’s poison.
I don’t care how many pails of milk I lose, as long as I don’t lose the cow.
Beggars can’t be choosers.
english.description: We use this common proverb when we do not have enough money to get what we want but only what we need.

english.text: The burden one likes is cheerfully carried.
It is easy to bear the misfortunes of others.
We come and cry and that is life, we cry and go and that is death.
The one who pleased everybody died before they were born.
The first breath is the beginning of death.
Nothing is certain but death and taxes.
Good men must die, but death cannot kill their names.
Fear of death is worse than death itself.
Death is the poor man’s best physician.
Death is the great leveler.
Death defies the doctor.
A lot of good arguments are spoiled by some fool who knows what he is talking about.
A sure way of getting the last word in an argument is to say you right.
An argument is like a country road, you never know where it is going to lead.
If you argue with a woman and win, you lose.
People who know the least always argue the most.
Rebuke with soft words and hard arguments.
Soft words win hard hearts.
There are usually two sides to every argument but no end.
There is no point in arguing about matters of taste.
Two dogs strive for a bone and the third one runs off with it.
Don’t meet troubles half-way.
The man who never makes a mistake always takes orders from one who does.
The first mistake are theirs who commit them, the second are theirs that permit them.
There will be sleeping enough in the grave.
He who eats alone chokes alone.
Private reproof is the best grave for private faults.
A trouble shared is a trouble halved.
When all are wrong, everyone is right.
When two quarrel, both are in the wrong.
After death the doctor.
Every one to his taste.
There is no accounting for tastes.
Don’t cry over spilt milk.
He that despiseth his neighbor sinneth; but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
Blessed are the merciful; for they shall obtain mercy.
Administer true justice; show mercy and compassion to one another.
A merciful person is merciful to their animals.
Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the body is weak.
We hate delays by others, but sometimes it makes us wise.
In times of trouble leniency becomes crime.
Each snowflake in an avalanche pleads its innocence.
You’ll repent if you marry, and repent if you don’t.
He that has no charity deserves no mercy.
Sincerity gives wings to power.
Fundamental sincerity is the only proper basis for forming a relationship.
We are very apt to measure ourselves by our aspiration instead of our performance. but in truth the conduct of our lives is the only proof of the sincerity of our hearts.
Wit is folly, unless a wise man has the keeping of it.
Keep your curiosity sharp, and you will never become too old to appreciate life.
A change is as good as a rest.
It is folly to sing twice to a deaf man.
All are not merry that dance lightly.
The devil dances in empty pockets.
The grass is always greener on the other side.
It is ill prizing of green barley.
For whom does the blind man’s wife paint herself?
Many a true word is spoken in jest.
The best throw of the dice is to throw them away.
Fools build houses, and wise men buy them.
A fool can ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.
Riches serve a wise man but command a fool.
He that’s a wise man by day is no fool by night.
A poor beauty finds more lovers than husbands.
Beauty is only skin deep.
The face is no index to the heart.
A smile is the light in the window of your face that tells people you’re at home.
I’ve never seen a smiling face that was not beautiful.
The most important thing you wear is the expression on your face.
Better to see the face than to hear the name.
Many hands make light work.
english.description: The more help we have from others, the easier a big job becomes to complete.

english.text: A smile costs nothing but gives much.
A smile is a light in the window of the soul indicating that the heart is at home.
It takes seventeen muscles to smile and forty-three to frown.
A smile is something you can’t give away; it always comes back to you.
A smile is a powerful weapon; you can even break ice with it.
Every day you spend without a smile, is a lost day.
Somewhere there’s someone who dreams of your smile, and finds in your presence that life is worth while. so when you are lonely, remember it’s true: somebody, somewhere is thinking of you.
All people smile in the same language.
If you would like to spoil the day for a grouch, give him a smile.
Never frown…even when you’re sad ’cause you never know when someone’s falling in love with your smile.
Some people grin and bear it; others smile and do it.
My heart smiled when you kissed my lips.
When you smile at someone, nine times out of 10 the other person will smile back and you’ve made two people’s days brighter and better.
Love begins with a smile, grows with a kiss, and ends with a teardrop.
By the way, i’m wearing the smile you gave me.
Wear a smile … one size fits all.
A smile can brighten the darkest day.
A smile is a curve that sets everything straight.
There are hundreds of languages in the world, but a smile speaks them all.
People are not perfect, except when they smile.
Remember me and smile, for it’s better to forget than remember me and cry.
You haven’t lost your smile at all, it’s right under your nose. you just forgot it was there.
The smile on your face lets me know that you need me, there’s a truth in your heart that says you’ll never leave me, and the touch of your hand says you’ll catch me whenever i fall.
Smile; it’s the second best thing one can do with one’s lips.
Smile, it lets your teeth breathe.
It is almost impossible to smile on the outside without feeling better on the inside.
You’ll find the smile more or less healing.
When you smiled you had my undivided attention. when you laughed you had my urge to laugh with you. when you cried you had my urge to hold you. when you said you loved me, you had my heart forever.
Smile – it increases your face value.

Don’t go for the looks, it can be quite deceiving. don’t go for wealth, even that fades away — go for someone who makes you smile because only a smile makes a dark day seem bright. hope you find that person.
It takes 26 muscles to smile, and 62 muscles to frown.
Smiling is infectious, you can catch it like the flu. someone smiled at me today, and i started smiling too.
Most smiles are started by another smile.
A smile is an inexpensive way to change your looks.
A friendly look, a kindly smile, one good act, and life’s worthwhile.
Life is like a mirror, we get the best results when we smile at it.
A winning smile makes winners of us all.
A smile confuses an approaching frown.
What prevents a man’s speaking good sense with a smile on his face?
Smile — sunshine is good for your teeth.
If you can smile when things go wrong, you have someone in mind to blame.
Nobody knows it, but you’ve got a secret smile, and you use it only for me.
If you don’t have a smile, i’ll give you one of mine.
You can say no and smile only when there’s a bigger yes burning inside you.
Leep smiling – it makes people wonder what you’ve been up to.
If you smile at someone, they might smile back.
If you don’t start out the day with a smile, it’s not too late to start practicing for tomorrow.
You cannot strike a face that is smiling.
A smile abroad is often a scowl at home."
It takes a lot of work from the face to let out a smile, but just think what good smiling can bring to the most important muscle of the body… the heart.
The world always looks brighter from behind a smile.
Take heed you do not find what you do not seek.
You may find the worst enemy or best friend in yourself.
Home is where you can say anything you like cause nobody listens to you anyway.
There’s no place like home.
You never miss the water till the well runs dry.
He laughs best who laughs last.
Laugh, and the world laughs with you; weep, and you weep alone.
Absence sharpens love; presence strengthens it.
The shortest answer is doing.
Well begun is half done.
If you want to be happy for a year, plant a garden; If you want to be happy for life, plant a tree.
The best laid plans of mice and men often go awry.
Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst.
Actions speak louder than words.
english.description: What you do matters – not what you say.

english.text: He that seeks trouble never misses.
if you don’t read the newspaper, you are uninformed. if you do read the newspaper, you are misinformed.
Dead news, like dead love, has no phoenix in its ashes.
Sticks and stones will break my bones, but names will never hurt me.
Stupidity won’t kill you, but it can make you sweat.
To talk without thinking is to shoot without aiming.
Leave a great talker in the middle of the street.
Time is the soul of business.
Better safe than sorry.
english.description: You should always be careful, even if you think it’s not necessary.

english.text: He helps little that helps not himself.
Envy shoots at others and wounds itself.
A nod of an honest man is enough.
Honesty is the poor man’s pork and the rich man’s pudding.
Honest men fear neither the light nor the dark.
Sorrow for a husband is like a pain in the elbow, sharp and short.
Few are fit to be entrusted with themselves.
It is an equal failing to trust everybody, and to trust nobody.
Venture a small fish to catch a much greater one.
The ship that will not obey the helm will have to obey the rocks.
In the morning be first up, and in the evening last to go to bed, for they that sleep catch no fish.
A proverb is the child of experience.
Adventures are to the adventurous.
A maid who laughs is half taken.
A smile is like tight underwear — it makes your cheeks go up.
Cover your mouth when you cough. never cover it when you smile.
Smiling is my favorite exercise!
We run away all the time to avoid corning face to face with ourselves.
A smile on the face is a sign that the heart is at home.
Your face could stop a clock
When the head aches, all the body is the worse.
Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.
We are usually the best men when in the worst health.
Choose a wife rather by your ear than by your eye.
Better a snotty child than his nose wiped off.
Children suck the mother when they are young and the father when they are old.
A dog is a man’s best friend.
All are not thieves that dogs bark at.
A joy that’s shared is a joy made double.
The mob has many heads but no brains.
An idle brain is the devil’s workshop.
Better a devil you know than a hundred strangers.
We walk by faith and not by sight.
Out of sight, out of mind.
english.description: We tend to forget about things we cannot see or hear.

english.text: Old sins cast long shadows.
Death is a shadow that always follows the body.
Yea, though i walk through the valley of the shadow of death, i will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
Light in the streets, shadows in the house.
keep me as the apple of the eye; hide me under the shadow of thy wings.
Where there is no vision, people perish.
Some people are born hammers, others anvils.
What the people believe is true.
A priest sees people at their best, a lawyer at their worst, but a doctor sees them as they really are.
People blame themselves for the purpose of being praised.
Praise makes good people better and bad people worse.
The cemeteries are filled with people who thought the world couldn’t get along without them.
There are three kinds of people; those that make things happen, those that watch things happen and those who don’t know what’s happening.
Zeal is fit only for wise men but is found mostly in fools.
He that is his own lawyer has a fool for a client.
He is a fool that kisseth the maid when he may kiss the mistress.
They are fools whose sheep run away twice.
All men are fools, but all fools are not men.
The heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
Every man has a fool up his sleeve.
It’s quite true there’s a fool born every minute. It’s also quite true they don’t die that fast.
Make it foolproof, and someone will make a better fool.
A great fortune in the hands of a fool is a great misfortune.
He is no fool who gives that which he cannot keep in order to gain that which he cannot lose.
Six hours for a man, seven for a woman, and eight for a fool.
There’s no fool like an old fool.
The fool is always beginning to live.
Beauty lies in the eye of the beholder.
A goose quill is more dangerous than a lion’s claw.
What will be, will be.
If you don’t have anything nice to say, don’t say anything at all.
Let every man praise the bridge he goes over.
Don’t judge a man until you have walked a mile in his shoes.
A full cup must be carried steadily.
Strike while the iron is hot.
english.description: ake action in favorable circumstances because they can change very quickly and it might not be as achieve success.

english.text: Absence is a shrew.
A ragged colt may make a good horse.
Make not your sail too big for your ballast.
Death always comes too early or too late.
An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
Big thunder, little rain.
Anger is often more hurtful than the injury that caused it.
Learning makes a man fit company for himself as well as for others.
Don’t look a gift horse in the mouth.
If wishes were horses, beggars would ride.
Conscience cannot be compelled.
It is better to begin in the evening than not at all.
God gives the milk but not the pail.
A fool may ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.
Never put off to tomorrow what you can do today.
A cold April the barn will fill.
Better late than never.
english.description: It’s better if you do something later, than not do it at all.

english.text: Crooked logs make straight fires.
Cats hide their claws.
Don’t count your chickens before they hatch.
english.description: When you do something in preparation for another thing that may not even happen. For example, I am going to buy a dress, even though no one has invited me to the party.

english.text: He who killed the lion when absent feared a mouse when present.
He that will steal an egg will steal an ox.
Time heals all wounds.
All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
Rome wasn’t built in a day.
english.description: The most important things in life take time. Don’t be in a hurry.

english.text: Power corrupts, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
If at first you don’t succeed, try, try again.
All for one and one for all.
Knowledge is power.
The bigger they are the harder they fall.
He that would the daughter win must with the mother first begin.
Beware of a man of one book.
Advice is least heeded when most needed.
Custom is the guide of the ignorant.
Gray hairs are death’s blossoms.
He that bulls the cow must keep the calf.
A shady lane breeds mud.
Don’t halt before you are lame.
An hour may destroy what an age was building.
Lightning never strikes twice in the same place.
The leopard cannot change its spots.
All clever men are birds of prey.
Ale in, wit out.
It’s money that begets money.
First deserve, and then desire.
A quiet conscience sleeps in thunder.
A friend to all is a friend to none.
A fair booty makes a fair thief.
You reap what you sow.
english.description: If a farmer plants potatoes, he will get potatoes, not another thing like tomatoes. Therefore, if we do good things we can expect good results, however, is we do wicked things we should expect the consequences.

english.text: There’s no such thing as bad publicity.
As you make your bed, so you must lie in it.
Misery loves company.
english.description: People who are unhappy want to make others unhappy too.

english.text: Once bitten, twice shy.
Age and wedlock tame man and beast.
The road to hell is paved with good intentions.
Blest is the bride the sun shines on.
Don’t judge a book by its cover.
english.description: This proverb is also called a metaphor, to teach us not to judge another person by the way they look on the outside.

english.text: April showers bring May flowers.
A stumble may prevent a fall.
There’s more than one way to skin a cat.
What’s good for the goose is good for the gander.
Age and wedlock bring a man to his nightcap.
Adversity flatters no man.
Don’t throw out the baby with the bath water.
He is a fool that kissed the maid when he may kiss the mistress.
Everyone must row with the oars he has.
Cheat me in the price, but not in the goods.
What goes around comes around.
A degenerate nobleman is like a turnip. There is nothing good of him but that which is underground.
Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.
Live and let live.
All is fair in love and war.
Don’t drown the man who taught you to swim.
It’s never too late to mend.
A rolling stone gathers no moss.
english.description: This proverb is talking about how if a person rumbles through life without ever stopping, they will gain nothing from life and no experience or benefit from it. It could be applied to a lot of areas of life such as relationships but a good example would be of somebody who constantly switched their job, moving from career to career without ever staying in one long enough to take any of the benefit from it or gain any experience in the field.

english.text: Friends are like fiddle strings; they must not be screwed too tight.
Character is easier kept than recovered.
Do not fall before you are pushed.
Beware of Greeks bearing gifts.
Don’t lock the stable door after the horse is stolen.
When it rains, it pours.
Don’t do all you can, spend all you have, believe all you hear, or tell all you know.
You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
Slow and steady wins the race.
Give a man a fish, he eats for a day. Teach a man how to fish, he eats for a lifetime.
Half a loaf is better than none.
The apple doesn’t fall far from the tree.
Don’t fall before you’re pushed.
Great minds think alike.
english.description: Smart people usually have the same ideas. This proverb is used when someone has the same idea as you.

english.text: You get what you pay for.
Look before you leap.
english.description: Make decisions carefully. Think about it first.

english.text: A place for everything and everything in its place.
Hindsight is 20/20
The show must go on.
A little bit of knowledge is a dangerous thing.
Much ado and little help.
A blind man will not thank you for a looking-glass.
Time is money.
english.description: The longer it takes to do something, the more costly it will be

english.text: A guilty conscience needs no accuser.
Two is company, three is a crowd.
You have to break a few eggs to make an omelet.
Accusing the times is but excusing ourselves.
You can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar.
A burnt child dreads the fire.
Two wrongs don’t make a right.
Whom we love best, to them we can say least.
In times of prosperity friends will be plenty, in times of adversity not one in twenty.
A good beginning makes a good ending.
Alms never make poor.
One picture is worth a thousand words.
Silence is golden.
Keep counsel of thyself first.
If you snooze, you lose.
english.description: You have to act fast to get what you want.

english.text: Ask God for what man can give, and you may get it.
Lie down with dogs, wake up with fleas.
english.description: If you associate with bad or dishonest people, bad things will happen to you.

english.text: The best way to a man’s heart is through his stomach.
If it’s not one thing it’s another.
Jack of all trades, master of none.
Each cross has its own inscription.
He that hath no children doth bring them up well.
Death keeps no calendar.
He who pays the piper may call the tune.
A small family is soon provided for.
An empty barrel makes the most noise.
A smooth sea never made a skillful mariner.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
english.description: When you are in another country, it’s better to behave like the citizens of this country.

english.text: Little strokes fell great oaks.
A puff of wind and popular praise weigh the same.
A joy that’s shared is a joy made double.
Education begins a gentleman, conversation completes him.
An enterprising fool needs little wit.
If you want a thing done, go. If not, send. The shortest answer is doing.
A man’s first care should be to avoid the reproaches of his own heart, his next to escape the censures of the world.
Far fowls have fair feathers.
Spread the table and contention will cease.
Necessity is the mother of invention.
english.description: There are situations in life when we can’t get the things we may need. It is often at these moments when we invent something to solve our problem, which is why necessity is the mother of invention.

english.text: Let him make use of instinct who cannot make use of reason.
Money is the root of all evil.
english.description: Money is the cause of all problems.

english.text: Measure twice, cut once.
It’s not over ’till the fat lady sings.
Don’t talk the talk if you can’t walk the walk.
english.description: Don’t brag about being able to do something, unless you actually know how to do it.

english.text: It takes all sorts to make a world.
A young man idle, an old man needy.
It’s no use crying over spilled milk.
Don’t put the cart before the horse.
What goes up must come down.
An abundance of money ruins youth.
A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
A black hen lays a white egg.
If you’re not part of the solution, you’re part of the problem.
If at first you don’t succeed, try again.
Don’t dig your grave with your own knife and fork.
A friend in need is a friend indeed.
english.description: If someone helps you when you have problems, or you are in trouble, that person is a true friend.

english.text: Do not triumph before the victory.
Do not be in a hurry to tie what you cannot untie.
Never fall out with your bread and butter.
A hero is a man who is afraid to run away.
Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
Absence makes the heart grow fonder.
english.description: Have you ever been separated from your loved one for a long time? You probably spent more time than normal thinking about them, which made you want to see that person even more.

english.text: A lie has short legs.
Haste makes waste.
english.description: When you try to work too quickly, you usually make mistakes.

english.text: Make not the sauce till you have caught the fish.
Chains of gold are stronger than chains of iron.
A broken clock is right twice a day.
Love your neighbor, yet pull not down your hedge.
He that does amiss may do well.
Every cloud has a silver lining.
You have to take the good with the bad.
It is ill fishing before the net.
Better the devil you know than the one you don’t.
A bad workman always blames his tools.
english.description: This proverb is used when someone blames the quality of their equipment or other external factors when they perform a task poorly.

english.text: A bird in hand is worth two in the bush.
english.description: Things we already have are more valuable than what we hope to get.

english.text: A cat has nine lives.
english.description: Cat can survive seemingly fatal events.

english.text: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
english.description: One weak part will render the whole weak.

english.text: A drowning man will clutch at a straw.
english.description: When someone is in a difficult situation, s/he will take any available opportunity to improve it.

english.text: Adversity and loss make a man wise.
english.description: We gain wisdom faster in difficult times than in prosperous times.

english.text: A fool and his money are soon parted.
english.description: Foolish people do not know how to hold on to their money.

english.text: A journey of thousand miles begins with a single step.
english.description: Howsoever big a task is, it starts with a small step.

english.text: A leopard can’t/ doesn’t change its spots.
english.description: A person can’t change its innate character, especially bad.

english.text: All good things come to an end.
english.description: Good experiences eventually come to an end.

english.text: All’s well that ends well.
english.description: As long as the outcome is good, problems on the way don’t matter.

english.text: All that glitters is not gold.
english.description: Things that look good outwardly may not be as valuable or good.

english.text: All’s fair in love and war.
english.description: One can break the rules of fair play under extenuating circumstances.

english.text: Always put your best foot forward.
english.description: Try as hard as you can or give your best.

english.text: Among the blind the one-eyed man is king.
english.description: An incapable person can gain powerful position if others in the fray are even more incapable.

english.text: An empty vessel makes much noise.
english.description: Foolish or stupid people are the most talkative.

english.text: An ounce of protection is worth a pound of cure.
english.description: A little precaution before a crisis hits is better than lot of firefighting afterwards.

english.text: A picture is worth a thousand words.
english.description: It is easier to show or explain something through a picture than through words.

english.text: Appearances can be deceptive.
english.description: Outward appearance may not be what you believe them to be.

english.text: A ship in the harbor is safe, but that is not what a ship is for.
english.description: Get out of your comfort zone to grow and fulfill your potential.

english.text: A stitch in time saves nine.
english.description: It’s better to deal with problems immediately rather than wait by when they worsen and become much bigger.

english.text: As you sow, so you shall reap.
english.description: Your actions – good or bad – determine what you get.

english.text: A thing begun is half done.
english.description: A good beginning makes it easier to accomplish the rest of the project.

english.text: Be slow in choosing, but slower in changing.
english.description: Choose things or people after proper diligence, but once you choose, stick for long.

english.text: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
english.description: What may seem beautiful to one person may not seem to another.

english.text: Best things in life are free.
english.description: The most valuable things are often free.

english.text: A cat in gloves catches no mice.
Better to be poor and healthy rather than rich and sick.
english.description: Good health is more important than money.

english.text: Better to wear out than to rust out.
english.description: It is better to remain active than to be idle (used mainly for old people)

english.text: Blood is thicker than water.
english.description: Relationships with family (or blood relatives) is stronger than other relationships.

english.text: Cleanliness is next to Godliness.
english.description: Cleanliness is a sign of goodness, a great virtue.

english.text: Clothes do not make the man.
english.description: A person’s character can’t be judged by his/ her clothing and outward appearance.

english.text: Cowards die many times before their deaths.
english.description: Cowards suffer the feared effects of death many times over in their lives.

english.text: Cross the stream where it is shallowest.
english.description: To do things in the easiest possible way.

english.text: East or West, home is best.
Curses, like chickens, come home to roost.
english.description: The consequences of doing wrong always catch up with the wrongdoer.

english.text: Discretion is the better part of valor.
english.description: It is wise to be careful and not show unnecessary bravery.

english.text: Don’t bite off more than you can chew.
english.description: Don’t take more responsibility than you can handle.

english.text: Don’t bite the hand that feeds you.
english.description: Don’t act badly toward the person who has helped you or from whom you derive some benefits, for you may lose those benefits in future.

english.text: Don’t blow your own trumpet.
english.description: You should avoid proudly talking of your achievements and success in front of others.

english.text: Don’t cast pearls before swine.
english.description: Don’t offer something valuable to someone who doesn’t value it.

english.text: Don’t cross a bridge until you come to it.
english.description: Deal with a situation when it happens and not unnecessarily worry about it in advance.

english.text: Don’t kill the goose that lays the golden eggs.
english.description: If you kill a goose that lays golden eggs, you destroy something that makes lot of money for you.

english.text: Don’t put all your eggs in one basket.
english.description: Don’t put all your effort into a single course of action, venture, investment, goal, or the like, because if it doesn’t work, you lose everything.

english.text: Don’t throw the baby with the bathwater.
english.description: Don’t discard something valuable while getting rid of something worthless.

english.text: Early bird catches the worm.
english.description: One who starts early on the work has higher chance of success.

english.text: Empty bags cannot stand upright.
english.description: A poor or hungry person cannot discharge his duties well.

english.text: Every man is the architect of his destiny.
english.description: Your own actions and decisions decide what you achieve (or don’t) in life.

english.text: Every man has his price.
english.description: Anyone can be swayed to do something. It’s just that some may demand high price, some low. This proverb is also used in the sense of bribing people.

english.text: Fall seven times. Stand up eight.
english.description: Be resilient and try despite failures. That’s how you succeed.

english.text: Familiarity breeds contempt.
english.description: If you know a situation, person, or thing well, you stop respecting them and become careless.

english.text: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
english.description: Fools or inexperienced persons get involved in situations or pursue goals without much thought. In contrast, wise are thoughtful about such situations or goals.

english.text: Fortune favors the brave.
english.description: If you carry out your plans boldly, the luck is more likely to favor you.

english.text: Get out while the going (getting) is good.
english.description: To leave a place or situation before conditions worsen and it becomes difficult to leave.

english.text: Give them an inch and they’ll take a mile.
english.description: If you give someone a small amount of power or freedom to do something, they may try to get a lot more.

english.text: God helps those who help themselves.
english.description: God doesn’t help those who don’t try. You’ve to make effort if you want to succeed.

english.text: Good things come to those who wait.
english.description: Patience is often rewarded.

english.text: Grief divided is made lighter.
english.description: If you share your grief, it’ll get easier to bear.

english.text: Honesty is the best policy.
english.description: It’s always better to be truthful and honest, even if the opposite may get you the benefits.

english.text: Hope for the best, prepare for the worst.
english.description: Be optimistic, but be prepared for a scenario where things can go wrong.

english.text: If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it.
english.description: If something is working fine, don’t change it unnecessarily.

english.text: If the mountain won’t come to Muhammad, Muhammad must go to the mountain.
english.description: If things don’t turn the way you want them to, then adjust your way to suit those things.

english.text: If you can’t beat them, join them.
english.description: If you can’t beat your opponent, then work alongside them for mutual benefit.

english.text: If you play with fire, you’ll get burned.
english.description: If you do something dangerous or adventurous, you may get harmed.

english.text: Ignorance is bliss.
english.description: If you don’t know about something, you don’t need to bother about it. In other words, if you’re unaware of something, it won’t cause you stress. This proverb, however, is often used in negative way – ignorance is not bliss.

english.text: It’s better to be safe than sorry.
english.description: Take your time, it’s better to get something done correctly the first time. Rather than to finish a task quickly and risk problems at a later date.

english.text: It’s easy to be wise after the event.
english.description: It is easy to understand what you could have done to prevent something bad from happening after it has happened.

english.text: It’s not over till it’s over.
english.description: Till the event has completely played, you’re still in with a chance to succeed.

english.text: It’s no use crying over spilt milk.
english.description: There is no point in staying upset over a mistake because you can’t undo what has happened.

english.text: It takes two to make a quarrel.
english.description: An argument of quarrel is not one person’s fault.

english.text: Laughter is the best medicine.
english.description: Thinking positively and laughing will help you to feel better.

english.text: Learn to walk before you run.
english.description: Learn basic skills first before venturing into complex things.

english.text: Life begins at forty.
english.description: A person truly starts enjoying life after forty as a result of accumulated skills and wisdom.

english.text: Make hay while the sun shines.
english.description: Make the most of favorable conditions till they last.

english.text: Money doesn’t grow on trees.
english.description: Spend money carefully because it’s limited. You can’t grow it on trees and replenish.

english.text: Money talks.
english.description: Money gives one power and influence.

english.text: Never put off until tomorrow what you can do today.
english.description: Don’t delay doing something if you can do it immediately.

english.text: Never test the depth of water with both feet.
english.description: If you’re in water with both feet down, you risk being swept away by the currents. The message is: don’t put all your eggs in the same basket. Think twice before placing all your bets and investments on one thing.

english.text: No gain without pain.
english.description: It is necessary to suffer or work hard in order to succeed or make progress.

english.text: No news is good news.
english.description: If you don’t receive any news about someone or something, it means that everything is fine and going normally.

english.text: Once bitten twice shy.
english.description: You say this proverb when someone won’t do something a second time because they had bad experience the first time.

english.text: One man’s junk is another man’s treasure.
english.description: What may seem to be junk to one person maybe valuable to another.

english.text: One shouldn’t miss forest for the trees.
english.description: Sometimes you get so focused on small details that you may miss the larger context.

english.text: Pen is mightier than sword.
english.description: Thinking and writing have more influence on people and events than use of force.

english.text: People who live in glass houses shouldn’t throw stones at others.
english.description: People who have faults should not criticize other people for having the same faults.

english.text: Practice makes perfect.
english.description: Doing something over and over makes one better at it.

english.text: Practice what you preach.
english.description: Behave the way you encourage other people to behave.

english.text: Silence is half consent.
english.description: If you don’t object to what someone says or does, you may be assumed to agree to some extent.

english.text: The best-laid plans go astray.
english.description: Despite best preparations, things may not go your way.

english.text: The end justifies the means.
english.description: A desired result is so important that any method, even a morally bad one, may be used to achieve it.

english.text: The harder you work, the luckier you get.
english.description: The harder you work, the more good ideas and chances you may make for yourself.

english.text: The grass is greener on the other side of the fence.
english.description: People are never satisfied with their own situation; they always think others have it better.

english.text: There are more ways than one to skin a cat.
english.description: There is more than one way to reach the same goal.

english.text: There is no time like the present.
english.description: The best time to do something is right now. So, act now.

english.text: There is safety in numbers.
english.description: A group offers more protection than when you are on your own.

english.text: The squeaky wheel gets the grease.
english.description: People who complain the most are the ones who get attention or what they want.

english.text: Time and tide wait for no man.
english.description: You’ve no control over passage of time; it’ll keep slipping. So don’t procrastinate, don’t delay things.

english.text: Two heads are better than one.
english.description: Two persons have a better chance to solve a problem than one. When two people cooperate with each other, they come up with better ideas.

english.text: Watch the doughnut, and not the hole.
english.description: Focus on what you have and not on what you don’t.

english.text: When the going gets tough, the tough get going.
english.description: When conditions become difficult, strong people take action.

english.text: Where there’s a will, there’s a way.
english.description: If you are determined enough, you can find a way to achieve what you want, even if it is difficult.

english.text: Where there’s smoke there’s fire.
english.description: If there are rumors or signs that something is true so it must be at least partly true.

english.text: Where one door shuts, another opens.
english.description: When you lose an opportunity to do one thing, an opportunity to do something else appears.

english.text: While the cat’s away, the mice will play.
english.description: Without supervision, people will do as they please, especially in disregarding or breaking rules.

english.text: You can lead a horse to water but you can’t make it drink.
english.description: You can show people the way to do things, but you can’t force them to act.

english.text: You can’t always get what you want.
english.description: Sometimes you may face disappointments in your pursuits or your wishes may not be fulfilled.

english.text: You can’t fit a round peg in a square hole.
english.description: You can’t force someone into a role for which s/he is not suited.

english.text: You can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs.
english.description: It is hard to achieve something important without causing unpleasant effects.

english.text: Soon learn, soon forgotten.
A little learning is a dangerous thing.
You can’t unscramble a scrambled egg.
english.description: Some actions are irreversible.

english.text: You can’t win them all.
english.description: It is not possible to succeed at everything you do.

english.text: You show me the man and I’ll show you the rule.
english.description: Rules change depending on how influential or powerful the person likely to be affected by the rules is.

english.text: The grass is always greener on the other side of the fence.
english.description: People always think other people are happier, more successful, living better lives than you. In many cases, this is not true. The lesson is to be grateful for what you have.

english.text: Half a loaf is better than no bread.
He that never climbed never fell.
If you run after two hares, you'll catch none.
It's never too late to learn.
It's no use crying over spilt milk.
It's a small world.
Better the devil you know than the one you don't.
english.description: When you have a choice between two bad things, it's safer to pick the bad thing that you've already experienced. The other bad thing might be worse.

english.text: Don't judge a man until you have walked a mile in his shoes.
english.description: Sometimes people criticize each other. But it's not fair to criticize someone else if you haven't had the same experiences.

english.text: Don't put the cart before the horse.
english.description: Pay attention to what's most important. Don't let things which aren't as important take up all of your time and attention.

english.text: Don't talk the talk if you can't walk the walk.
english.description: You shouldn't brag about being able to do something if you can't actually do it.

english.text: Don't throw out the baby with the bath water.
english.description: When you're trying to get rid of something bad, you might accidentally get rid of the good things that are connected with it as well. Don't do that.

english.text: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again.
english.description: Keep working hard and trying to succeed, even if you fail at first.

english.text: If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all.
english.description: Don't say mean things about other people.

english.text: If you're not part of the solution, you're part of the problem.
english.description: Don't just complain about problems that you see. Do something to solve the problems.

english.text: It's no use crying over spilled milk.
english.description: If you break something, lose money, etc., don't get too upset about it. It's already happened, so getting upset isn't useful.

english.text: It's not over 'till the fat lady sings.
english.description: Say this in a competition or game. When other people think that the result has already been decided, but you're not ready to admit that it's finished, use this phrase.

english.text: Never put off till (until) tomorrow what you can do today.
english.description: Don't be lazy. If you have some work that you need to do, do it now. Don't wait to do it later.

english.text: Rome wasn't built in a day.
english.description: Doing important work takes a long time. Be patient.

english.text: There is no rose without a thorn.
You scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours.
The apple doesn't fall far from the tree.
english.description: Children are very similar to their parents.

english.text: The best way to a man's heart is through his stomach.
english.description: Men love women who can cook well.

english.text: There's no such thing as bad publicity.
english.description: When people talk about a business, it's good for the business, even if they're saying bad things about it.

english.text: A tree is known by its fruit.
What's good for the goose is good for the gander.
english.description: A goose is a type of bird. A gander is the male version of that bird. So this phrase means that things which are good for women are also good for men, and vice versa.

english.text: You can't have your cake and eat it too.
english.description: This means that you can't have everything you want. There are trade-offs in life. You may also hear people say that you can have your cake and eat it too.

english.text: You can't teach an old dog new tricks.
english.description: Older people don't change their habits easily.

english.text: Two wrongs don't make a right.
english.description: When someone has done something bad to you, trying to get revenge will only make things worse.

english.text: The pen is mightier than the sword.
english.description: Trying to convince people with ideas and words is more effective than trying to force people to do what you want.

english.text: When in Rome, do as the Romans.
english.description: Act the way that the people around you are acting. This phrase might come in handy when you're traveling abroad notice that people do things differently than you're used to.

english.text: We must learn to walk before we can run.
No man is an island.
english.description: You can't live completely independently. Everyone needs help from other people.

english.text: Fortune favors the bold.
english.description: People who bravely go after what they want are more successful than people who try to live safely.

english.text: People who live in glass houses should not throw stones.
english.description: Don't criticize other people if you're not perfect yourself.

english.text: Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.
english.description: If you have an enemy, pretend to be friends with them instead of openly fighting with them. That way you can watch them carefully and figure out what they're planning.

english.text: There's no such thing as a free lunch.
english.description: Things that are offered for free always have a hidden cost.

english.text: There's no place like home.
english.description: Your own home is the most comfortable place to be.

english.text: Discretion is the greater part of valor.
english.description: Sometimes it's important to know when to give up and run away, instead of always acting brave and maybe getting hurt.

english.text: The early bird catches the worm.
english.description: You should wake up and start work early if you want to succeed.

english.text: Never look a gift horse in the mouth.
english.description: If someone offers you a gift, don't question it.

english.text: You can't make an omelet without breaking a few eggs.
english.description: When you try to do something great, you'll probably make a few people annoyed or angry. Don't worry about those people; just focus on the good results.

english.text: You can't always get what you want.
english.description: Don't whine and complain if you don't get what you wanted.

english.text: A watched pot never boils.
english.description: If something takes time to finish, don't watch it too closely because it will seem like it's taking forever.

english.text: Beggars can't be choosers.
english.description: If you're asking for a favor from someone else, you have to take whatever they give you.

english.text: All is well that ends well.
If it ain't broke, don't fix it.
english.description: Don't try to improve something that already works fairly well. You'll probably end up causing new problems.

english.text: People who live in glass houses should not throw stones at others.
english.description: It means to say that a person should not criticize others when they themselves have similar faults or are not completely faultless.

english.text: You cannot teach old dogs new tricks.
Who keeps company with the wolf, will learn to howl.
When the fox preaches, take care of your geese.
We never know the value of water till the well is dry.
То throw a stone in one's own garden.
A leopard cannot change its spots.
english.description: Can the Ethiopian change his skin, or the leopard his spots? Then may ye also do good, that are accustomed to do evil.

english.text: A great dowry is a bed full of brambles.
A little body often harbours a great soul.
A liar is not believed when he speaks the truth.
A Jack of all trades is master of none.
Don't bite the hand that feeds you.
english.description: If someone's paying you or helping you out, you have to be careful not to make them angry or say bad things about them.

english.text: All good things must come to an end.
english.description: You can't keep having good luck or fun forever; eventually it will stop.

english.text: One drop of poison infects the whole tun of wine.
If you can't beat 'em, join 'em.
english.description: When you try to change someone's behavior and it doesn't work, you might have to change instead. For example, if you're trying to get your classmates to focus on studying but they want to party, maybe you should just party with them.

english.text: One man's trash is another man's treasure.
english.description: Different people have different ideas about what's valuable.

english.text: There's no time like the present.
english.description: If you need to do something, don't wait until later. Do it now.

english.text: Don’t make a mountain out of an anthill
The cat is out of the bag
english.description: Truth will out

english.text: Put your best foot forward.
A penny saved is a penny earned.
english.description: Save your money. Saving money is just like making money.

english.text: You can't judge a book by its cover.
english.description: Things sometimes look different than they really are. A restaurant that looks old and small might have amazing food, for example.

english.text: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
english.description: Have a backup plan. Don't risk all of your money or time in one plan.

english.text: The grass is always greener on the other side of the hill.
english.description: People tend to want whatever they don't have.

english.text: Don’t cross the bridge until you come to it.
He that mischief hatches mischief catches.
As the fool thinks, so the bell clinks.
Where there's muck there's brass.
A cat may look at a king.
A little knowledge is a dangerous thing.
Like father, like son.
A man is known by the company he keeps.
You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink.
english.description: If you try to help someone, but they don't take your advice or offers, give up. You can't force someone to accept your help.

english.text: Don't count your chickens before they hatch.
english.description: Your plans might not work out, so don't start thinking about what you'll do after you succeed. Wait until you've already succeeded, and then you can think about what to do next.

english.text: If you want something done right, you have to do it yourself.
english.description: Don't trust other people to do important things for you. You have to do things yourself to control the quality of the results.

english.text: You can’t judge a book by its cover.
english.description: Do not judge things by the way they appear, their actual nature or function might be completely different.
